page.title: 09Restoration of the Church
page.content: In the twentieth century much has been done in restoring the church both inside and outside. In 1904 the top of the two tiered pulpit was taken away and later a new oak pulpit was installed in place of the lower part. Today a mammoth task is the restoration of the roof which is estimated will cost 25,000, of which 20,000 was raised in six months. The organ also needs major restoration and the well known organ builders Bishop & Son are already hard at work rebuilding it. There is a faithful congregation who come particularly to the family service, although attendance is not as high as it was many years ago, probably owing to the advent of radio and television. Even the Methodist Chapel built in 1879 is now used only for Christmas Fayres, Jumble Sales and Barn Dances.
